div.p: This element belongs conceptually with WRITING PRODUCTION . It refers to a non-textual packaging/format of a written work. If someone adapts a woman's book into an opera, a film, a sound recording or a dance, record it here. PNONBOOKMEDIA captures either a word or more frequently a full statement. There are no mandatory sub-elements or attributes for this element.

div.codeblock: <PNONBOOKMEDIA> Mary Poppins became a Disney film classic.</PNONBOOKMEDIA>

div.p: When encountering a film adaptation of a woman writer's work, we use PNONBOOKMEDIA. When she writes the script herself, use TGENRE tag with attribute value FilmTvScript. If she writes a script for filming someone’s else’s book, also use the intertextuality tag with the attribute for adaptation/update.
